page.title: 05LIVERTON VILLAGE
page.content: { {Liverton Village}has a population of about 250.There are approximately 80 houses.Some are older cottages.Some are owned by the council.But some are modern and are in a private estate.5 buildings are not houses.One is a{Soap {factory}that was built on the grounds of an old pottery.The village has a{ {general store}called{Windsors}(the name of the people who own it).There is a builders workshop in use.The village has a{Village Hall}which holds Brownies,Guides,Autumn Club,Childrens and Dance meetings,Whist Drives and Bingo,Elections and Jumble Sales.There is a telephone box opposite a block of houses.A daily{Bus service}runs to { {Newton Abbot}(mornings and evenings) On the private estate there is a private green.Children and dogs are not allowed on it.
